owl:Ontology.dc:creator: María Poveda Villalón
Serge Chávez Feria
owl:Ontology.dc:description: The Key Performance Indicator module aims to model the metrics defined at the beginning of building renovation activities to monitor the conformance with typical requirements related to energy efficient buildings.
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Key Performance Indicator ontology

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The building element comprises all elements that are primarily part of the construction of a building, i.e., its structural and space separating system. Building elements are all physically existent and tangible things.
See definition in http://bimerr.iot.linkeddata.es/def/building#Element
KPI metric related to the residents comfort level for a building renovation project.
KPI metric related to the economic aspects of a building renovation project.
KPI metric focused on the energy aspects of a building renovation project.
Goals or subgoals describe the objetives to be achieved within the renovation process. For instance: "Stay within estimated budget"
Represents the sources of information used to estimate the value of a parameter.
Key performance indicator values calculated for a specific renovation project and scenario.
Key performance indicators related to building renovation projects
Costs associated to the material layers such as installation, disposal, or maintenance costs.
Represent the parameters or variables that are used to measure the performance of an specific task, and are useful to compute project KPI's.
A project is a temporary endeavor undertaken to achieve defined objectives (definition taken from DBpedia).
Renovation action to be applied on the project. For example: Renovation of external facade insulation.
The simluation of a building renovation work.
KPI metric focused on the sustainability of a building renovation project.
KPI metric related to temporal metrics for a building renovation project.
Address of a project.
Indicates what are the building elements affected by the renovation measure.
Indicates what are the layers of a specific building element affected by the renovation measure.
Affected area of the building element due to a renovation measure.
A KPI value is assessed within the context of a project.
A KPI value is assessed within the context of a scenario.
Links to the parameter used to compute a KPI value.
The most recent editing date of a project.
Value of layer cost.
Link to link a project with a set of goals.
Relates a KPI definition with their values.
Relates a project with renovation scenarios.
Relates to the information source where the parameter came from.
Relationship used to decompose a project goal into more specific sub-goals.
Relates an entity with a unit of measure.
Global ID used in the IFC file.
Upper limit to define a KPI Value.
Lower limit to define a KPI Value.
A goal need to monitor a set of KPI values, to verify its accomplishment.
Links to the building the project is about.
A renovation scenario is simulated within the context of a project.
Tolerance error in the value of a KPI.
See definition in http://bimerr.iot.linkeddata.es/def/material-properties#MaterialLayer
Position of the layer within the set of layers that compose a building element.
Thickness of the layer.
The ISO country code where the project is being developed.
The date when the project was created.
Time extent; duration of a time interval separate from its particular start position.
A temporal interval or instant.
A Key Performance Indicator (KPI) is a type of performance measurement. KPIs evaluate the success of an organization or of a particular activity in which it engages. (Definition taken from FIWARE)
A Key Performance Indicator assessment represents the assessment of a KPI calculated by a given agent in a given time.
Indicates the calculation period of a KPI.
A KPI value quantifies a specific KPI.
Property to add a time stamp to a KPI value.

The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property. For example, Power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power called "watt". Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM). We propose here a list of some units of measure that are relevant for the purpose of the Smart Appliances ontology, but this list can be extended.
Numeric quantity of a KPI value.
Link a KPI value to a unit of measure.
